newsitem.title: USA: Eagle Cos. buys LA forwarder.
newsitem.headline: Eagle Cos. buys LA forwarder.

text.p: Eagle Cos, a Miami-based freight forwarder and logistics company, formed a joint venture with Los Angeles-based trucking and warehouse firm Customs Air Warehouse, expanding its presence on the West Coast, Eagle's chief executive said Thursday.
"This will solidify our ability to handle shipments to and from Asia," Raul Pedraza, CEO and president of Eagle Cos, told Reuters.
Many transportation and forwarding companies serving Latin America are working on strategies so they can grab a share of the growing trade between Latin America and Asia and other parts of the world.
The new joint venture, named Eagle West, will be run by Tony Gregory, Customs Air's founder.
"We are ecstatic about partnering with a quality firm like Customs Air Warehouse," Pedraza said.
The Los Angeles facility has 30,000 square feet of bonded warehouse space, customs brokerage services, and 35 trucks.
